content: front of your work so you always know your right and wrong sides and continue half_double_crochet to every chain to the end ch1 turn you have 59- 62- 66- 71 half_double_crochet ws half_double_crochet to the end ch1 turn rs * half_double_crochet to last 5hdc on prev row ch1 turn ws half_double_crochet to the end ch1 turn rs half_double_crochet to last 4hdc on prev row ch1 turn ws half_double_crochet to the end ch1 turn rs half_double_crochet to last 3hdc on prev row ch1 turn ws half_double_crochet to the end ch1 turn rs half_double_crochet to last 5hdc on prev row ch1 turn ws half_double_crochet to the end ch1 turn rs half_double_crochet to the end of the stairs so you again have 59-62- 66- 71 half_double_crochet ch1 turn these stairs shape your top of the hat ws half_double_crochet to the end ch1 turn rs half_double_crochet to the end ch1 turn ws half_double_crochet to the end ch1 turn * repeat from * to * 8- 9-10- 11 more times total of 9- 10- 11- 12 times after your last repeat make 1 more half_double_crochet row join hat by slip_stitch weave all ends rib edge note you will be repeating 2 row only ch1 doesn t count as a stitch rib is same width for all sizes chain 23 row1 half_double_crochet to the 2nd chain from your hook and to the end ch1 turn total 22hdc row2 slip_stitch to every half_double_crochet ch1 turn repeat row 1 and 2 for 40 5- 44- 47 5- 51 cm measurements for ribbing is only a guide if you like hat to be more tight fitting then make ribbing bit shorter measure ribbing unstreched lay flat on surface finishing the hat make a pompom from the yarn you used to make hat or you can add fur one if you like attach ribbing to the edge of the hat by slip stitching both pieces weave all ends in attach pompom and your amazing work is done
